comments.body: In the tests above what are you doing to check "only" the genericEnabled case of each source?  I'm not sure I follow your logic on these tests?

The idea is that if the new generic data source feature gate is enabled, it doesn't matter what the other 2 feature gates are set to, because anything is allowed. In theory these 3 feature gates could be set 8 different ways, but it's not worth testing all the combinations. I focused on the worthwhile combinations here with my tests.

> The idea is that if the new generic data source feature gate is enabled, it doesn't matter what the other 2 feature gates are set to

Agreed, but I would argue that it is worth testing all of the combinations.
